title: On Your Mark… 8 Holiday Party Outfits to Have on Your Radar (Before Everyone Else)
description: Who doesn't love getting dressed up?
excerpt: The holiday season is coming up, so we're looking to our favorite trendsetters for holiday party outfit ideas. See and shop the most elegant party looks for the holidays here.
text: [Mariah Carey voice] It's timeeee!With Thanksgiving a little over a week away, the holiday season is upon us, transforming our calendars into a festive whirlwind of celebrations. This is my favorite part of the year, as it's a time to come together, reflect on the successes of the past months, and, of course, indulge in the joy of dressing up.To avoid the last-minute scramble of piecing together an outfit, I've embarked on a quest for stunning outfit inspiration to set the tone for my event-filled calendar. Whether I will be at a lavish black-tie gala, a casual office gathering, or an upscale cocktail event with friends, I want my outfits to embody a chic, modern, and playful essence, highlighting flattering silhouettes crafted from luxurious fabrics.If you too are looking for holiday party outfit ideas that are simple and polished but anything but basic, look no further. Below, I'm sharing eight party-ready ensembles that are effortlessly chic and easy to re-create. From enchanting holiday dresses to trendy skirts, there’s plenty of inspiration for everyone looking to shine this season.Strapless Top + Lace SkirtHear me out: The cool-girl holiday uniform will center on a sheer lace skirt. Paired with a long peplum top or blazer, the skirt covers the hips and upper thighs, exposing just a bit of leg at the mid-thighs and knees. Of course, depending on the type of party, you can also lean into the skirt's naked quality and wear it with just a pair of bloomers underneath.Shop the look: Banana Republic Everywhere Ponte Strapless Top Reformation Gracelynn Pump Pandora Sparkling Small Bow Stud Earrings Camisole + Wide-Leg TrousersWhen in doubt this holiday season, pair wide-leg trousers with a stylish camisole. This combination not only exudes effortless elegance but also allows for versatility; you can dress it up with heels and accessories for a night out or keep it casual with flats for a relaxed daytime look. Plus, it's very appropriate for a corporate party.Shop the look: Favorite Daughter The Favorite Pants Schutz Lou Pointed Toe Pump Alaïa Teckel Small Leather Shoulder Bag Pandora Be Love Engravable Heart Charm Velvet Maxi DressVelvet is always in style during the holiday season, offering a rich and festive look. So re-create Creative Director, interior designer, and writer Abisola Omole's outfit with a velvet maxi dress featuring lace embellishments. Finish with tights, a mini bag, and T-bar heels because suddenly, every fashion person (think Jennifer Lopez, Nicole Kidman, and Zoe Saldaña) is wearing them.Shop the look: Reformation Adessa Velvet Dress H&M Pointed T-Strap Pumps Sweater + Textured SkirtElevate your style this holiday season by choosing a textured skirt, especially in a golden hue. Not only will it boost your mood, but it will also convey your keen fashion sense to those around you. Pair it with an elegant sweater and sophisticated heels for the perfect look.Shop the look: j.crew Sheer Metallic Boatneck Top Elie Tahari Zoey Sequined Fringe Midi-Skirt J.Crew Maisie Mary Jane Heels Lace Maxi DressA holiday party is the ideal occasion to dress up and showcase your style, and what better way to make a statement than by wearing an elegant power dress that truly turns heads? Picture a stunning maxi dress adorned with intricate sheer lace embellishments that gracefully reveal just the right amount of skin, accentuating your silhouette in a sophisticated manner. With such a striking dress as the centerpiece of your ensemble, you can keep your accessories understated—a pair of classic black heels, whether sleek pumps or chic sock-like boots, will complete your look beautifully.Shop the look: Delfi Collective Addison Sheer Lace Maxi Dress COS Mini Cavatelli Clutch Jeffrey Campbell Checkmate Boots Cape + MinidressThe most buzzworthy trend for winter 2024 is undoubtedly cape outerwear, and it's set to be a highlight of holiday fashion. A stunning illustration of this style is found in the ensemble of Parisian trendsetter Emmanuelle Koffi. She effortlessly showcases the elegance of a cape, proving it to be a versatile and chic addition to any wardrobe. To create a similar look, pair a beautifully crafted cape with a wardrobe staple, such as the editor-favorite Norma Kamali Pickleball dress. Complete the outfit with tights and square-toe pumps.Shop the look: ZARA Asymmetrical Fringed Wool Blend Cape NORMA KAMALI Ruched Stretch-Jersey Mini Dress Falke Seidenglatt 15 Tights MANGO 100% Leather Square-Toe Shoes Blouse + Sequin MiniskirtThe holiday season wouldn’t feel complete without the sparkle of sequins, particularly when it comes to a dazzling sequin miniskirt. This eye-catching garment is the perfect foundation for creating a standout outfit, especially if you're gearing up for a fun night out with friends. Style it like European style influencer Ingrid Edvinsen did with a black top and sheer tights. Don’t forget a silver handbag.Shop the look: We The Free Iris Layering Top JIMMY CHOO Callie Embellished Metallic Leather Shoulder Bag H&M 2-Pack 20 Denier Tights Leather Trench Coat + Sheer TightsI've been observing polished Parisian fashion girls wearing leather trench coats as dresses, and I'm here for it. It's sleek and sophisticated, especially when styled with tights and pumps.Shop the look: Babaton New Tabloid Trench Coat HUE Age Defiance French Lace Sheer Tights Black Suede Studio Logan 50MM Box Leather Mules The Row Mini Devon Leather Top Handle Bag Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
html:
[Mariah Carey voice] It's timeeee!

With Thanksgiving a little over a week away, the holiday season is upon us, transforming our calendars into a festive whirlwind of celebrations. This is my favorite part of the year, as it's a time to come together, reflect on the successes of the past months, and, of course, indulge in the joy of dressing up.

To avoid the last-minute scramble of piecing together an outfit, I've embarked on a quest for stunning outfit inspiration to set the tone for my event-filled calendar. Whether I will be at a lavish black-tie gala, a casual office gathering, or an upscale cocktail event with friends, I want my outfits to embody a chic, modern, and playful essence, highlighting flattering silhouettes crafted from luxurious fabrics.

If you too are looking for holiday party outfit ideas that are simple and polished but anything but basic, look no further. Below, I'm sharing eight party-ready ensembles that are effortlessly chic and easy to re-create. From enchanting holiday dresses to trendy skirts, there’s plenty of inspiration for everyone looking to shine this season.

Strapless Top + Lace Skirt

Hear me out: The cool-girl holiday uniform will center on a sheer lace skirt. Paired with a long peplum top or blazer, the skirt covers the hips and upper thighs, exposing just a bit of leg at the mid-thighs and knees. Of course, depending on the type of party, you can also lean into the skirt's naked quality and wear it with just a pair of bloomers underneath.

Shop the look:

Banana Republic

Everywhere Ponte Strapless Top

Reformation

Gracelynn Pump

Pandora

Sparkling Small Bow Stud Earrings

Camisole + Wide-Leg Trousers

When in doubt this holiday season, pair wide-leg trousers with a stylish camisole. This combination not only exudes effortless elegance but also allows for versatility; you can dress it up with heels and accessories for a night out or keep it casual with flats for a relaxed daytime look. Plus, it's very appropriate for a corporate party.

Shop the look:

Favorite Daughter

The Favorite Pants

Schutz

Lou Pointed Toe Pump

Alaïa

Teckel Small Leather Shoulder Bag

Pandora

Be Love Engravable Heart Charm

Velvet Maxi Dress

Velvet is always in style during the holiday season, offering a rich and festive look. So re-create Creative Director, interior designer, and writer Abisola Omole's outfit with a velvet maxi dress featuring lace embellishments. Finish with tights, a mini bag, and T-bar heels because suddenly, every fashion person (think Jennifer Lopez, Nicole Kidman, and Zoe Saldaña) is wearing them.

Shop the look:

Reformation

Adessa Velvet Dress

H&M

Pointed T-Strap Pumps

Sweater + Textured Skirt

Elevate your style this holiday season by choosing a textured skirt, especially in a golden hue. Not only will it boost your mood, but it will also convey your keen fashion sense to those around you. Pair it with an elegant sweater and sophisticated heels for the perfect look.

Shop the look:

j.crew

Sheer Metallic Boatneck Top

Elie Tahari

Zoey Sequined Fringe Midi-Skirt

J.Crew

Maisie Mary Jane Heels

Lace Maxi Dress

A holiday party is the ideal occasion to dress up and showcase your style, and what better way to make a statement than by wearing an elegant power dress that truly turns heads? Picture a stunning maxi dress adorned with intricate sheer lace embellishments that gracefully reveal just the right amount of skin, accentuating your silhouette in a sophisticated manner. With such a striking dress as the centerpiece of your ensemble, you can keep your accessories understated—a pair of classic black heels, whether sleek pumps or chic sock-like boots, will complete your look beautifully.

Shop the look:

Delfi Collective

Addison Sheer Lace Maxi Dress

COS

Mini Cavatelli Clutch

Jeffrey Campbell

Checkmate Boots

Cape + Minidress

The most buzzworthy trend for winter 2024 is undoubtedly cape outerwear, and it's set to be a highlight of holiday fashion. A stunning illustration of this style is found in the ensemble of Parisian trendsetter Emmanuelle Koffi. She effortlessly showcases the elegance of a cape, proving it to be a versatile and chic addition to any wardrobe. To create a similar look, pair a beautifully crafted cape with a wardrobe staple, such as the editor-favorite Norma Kamali Pickleball dress. Complete the outfit with tights and square-toe pumps.

Shop the look:

ZARA

Asymmetrical Fringed Wool Blend Cape

NORMA KAMALI

Ruched Stretch-Jersey Mini Dress

Falke

Seidenglatt 15 Tights

MANGO

100% Leather Square-Toe Shoes

Blouse + Sequin Miniskirt

The holiday season wouldn’t feel complete without the sparkle of sequins, particularly when it comes to a dazzling sequin miniskirt. This eye-catching garment is the perfect foundation for creating a standout outfit, especially if you're gearing up for a fun night out with friends. Style it like European style influencer Ingrid Edvinsen did with a black top and sheer tights. Don’t forget a silver handbag.

Shop the look:

We The Free

Iris Layering Top

JIMMY CHOO

Callie Embellished Metallic Leather Shoulder Bag

H&M

2-Pack 20 Denier Tights

Leather Trench Coat + Sheer Tights

I've been observing polished Parisian fashion girls wearing leather trench coats as dresses, and I'm here for it. It's sleek and sophisticated, especially when styled with tights and pumps.

Shop the look:

Babaton

New Tabloid Trench Coat

HUE

Age Defiance French Lace Sheer Tights

Black Suede Studio

Logan 50MM Box Leather Mules

The Row

Mini Devon Leather Top Handle Bag

Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
